data.title: Children's Medical Association
meta_keywords:
Coral Springs pediatrician
affordable pediatrician in Miramar
pediatrician in Tamarac
pediatrician in Plantation
data.meta_description: Discover pediatric services at Children's Medical Association in Coral Springs, Tamarac, Plantation, and Miramar. Stay informed with our Covid-19 updates. Vaccine available for ages 12+. Contact us at 954-722-0300.
data.text:
We are pleased to announce that we have started seeing patients in our new Children’s Medical Association Miramar location at 1951 SW 172nd Avenue Suite 200, Miramar FL 33029. Our office is located inside the Memorial Miramar Medical Office Building. Drs. Leon, Valdes, Deulofeut, Patzke, Ward and Rojas who are fluent in Spanish and English, will be available for regular Well Child Check Ups with vaccinations and sick visits. Please call or text 954-722-0300 to schedule an appointment or login to the patient portal at yourhealthfile.com to schedule an appointment. We look forward to seeing you there!

No more waiting on hold on the phone to make an appointment or cancel an appointment for your child! Simply TEXT us at 954-722-0300. Stay safe and be well. ❤️

No more waiting on hold on the phone to make an appointment or cancel an appointment for your child! Simply TEXT us at 954-722-0300. Stay safe and be well. ❤️

No more waiting on hold on the phone to make an appointment or cancel an appointment for your child! Simply TEXT us at our regular number. Stay safe and be well. ❤️

To help inform you about the latest coronavirus updates, experts from Children's Medical Association have gathered information from local and national health authorities

Racism is a public health issue. As pediatricians, we condemn violence, as we recognize the impact of the death of George Floyd and its repercussions felt all over our country. Your children may have questions. We encourage you to learn more by following the link to the the AAP Policy Statement on The Impact of Racism on Child and Adolescent Health. Read More >>>

How Old Is Too Old for a Pediatrician?

The question of when to stop seeing the pediatrician usually crops up around the onset of your child’s teenage years. However, at CMA we offer care way beyond the teenage years. We will see your child until they turn 21.

Please call our office to schedule a prenatal visit at no charge to you. We think this is a wonderful way for you to meet your child's new pediatrician.

Whether your newborn comes into the world at an affiliated or unaffiliated hospital, or a birthing center, we are happy to welcome them to the CMA family.

Please call our office to schedule a prenatal visit at no charge to you. We think this is a wonderful way for you to meet your child's new pediatrician.

Whether your newborn comes into the world at an affiliated or unaffiliated hospital, or a birthing center, we are happy to welcome them to the CMA family.

At Children's Medical Association we accept most health insurance plans. Please call our office to verify that we accept your insurance. If we are not your child's PCP, please contact your insurance to make this change. We are here to assist you with your insurance questions or concerns.
